content: If a car travels at a constant speed of 60 mph and needs to cover a distance of 180 miles, how long will it take to reach its destination?

To determine how long it will take for the car to travel 180 miles at a constant speed of 60 mph, we can use the formula:

Time = Distance / Speed

Plugging in the given values:

Time = 180 miles / 60 mph = 3 hours

Therefore, it will take the car 3 hours to reach its destination.
